title: Plot a point in the coordinate plane
prompt: What are the coordinates of the point identified on the graph below? (Use the form <math> <mrow>  <mo maxsize="1.00em" form="prefix">(</mo>  <mi>a</mi>  <mo>,</mo>  <mi>b</mi>  <mo maxsize="1.00em" form="postfix">)</mo> </mrow> </math>.)
hint: The first coordinate is the horizontal distance; the second coordinate is the vertical distance.
feedback: To identify the point on the graph with coordinates, first identify how far away from the origin the point is in the x direction, in this case -3. Next count how far away the point is from the origin in the y direction, in this case 6. The ordered pair that describes the point as a coordinate on the graph is written with parentheses and a comma between the coordinates in the order ( x , y ) . In this case, the coordinate would be ( -3 , 6 ) .
